net.hudup.listener

Class Delegator

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.hudup.core.client.ProtocolImpl
      • net.hudup.listener.AbstractDelegator
        • net.hudup.listener.Delegator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable, Protocol, Runner

    public class Delegator
extends AbstractDelegator
    This class is full implementation of delegator. It inherits directly AbstractDelegator. Delegator is responsible for handling and processing user request represented by Request. Each time Listener receives a user request, it creates a respective delegator and passes such request to delegator. After that delegator processes and dispatches the request to the proper binding server. The result of recommendation process from server, represented by Response, is sent back to users/applications by delegator. In fact, delegator interacts directly with server. However, delegator is a part of Listener and the client-server interaction is always ensured.
    Version:
    10.0
    Author:
    Loc Nguyen

    • Field Detail

      • server

        protected PowerServer server
        The power server binds with this delegator. The delegator dispatches request to this server. The result of recommendation process from server, represented by Response, is sent back to users/applications by delegator. In fact, the service service of this server processed the request.

        protected Service service
        The service of the binding server server actually processes request from the delegator.

        public Delegator(java.net.Socket socket,
                 PowerServer server)
        Constructor with specified socket and power server.
        Parameters:
        socket - specified Java socket for receiving (reading) requests from client and sending back (writing) responses to client via input / output streams.
        server - power server binds with this delegator. The delegator dispatches request to this server. The result of recommendation process from server, represented by Response, is sent back to users/applications by delegator. In fact, the service service of this server processed the request.
